description.content: Ally must dash 3 spaces in a straight line before using the ability.
Teleport your ally to an adjacent space to you after the action resolves.
Bless all allies in a small blast area centered on your ally.
If the ability forces saves, foes get +2 curses to save against them.
Ally becomes unstoppable and immune to all damage while moving during the ability.
Ally becomes pacified but is cured after the ability resolves.
Ally gains stealth after the ability resolves.
Ally makes all attacks and saves with +1 Boon until the start of their next turn, including with the triggering ability.
Ally gains Evasion until the start of their next turn.
Ally gains Counter and Sturdy, but cannot gain or benefit from stealth or evasion until the start of their next turn.
Ally becomes Unstoppable until the start of their next turn.
An entire herd of animals or monsters.

subcontent.content: Saves are successful on an 9+ instead of a 10+
Deal bonus damage in the first round of combat.
Start that combat with 2 vigor, or +2 vigor if you already start with Vigor.
Gain resistance to all damage in the first round of combat.
No result. Next time you fish, add +1d to your roll.
Collect 2 of these fish and they can be sold at market for 1 dust. Dungeon guppies, cave carp, and Arkentrout are all pretty common examples.
Rare Fish!: Roll 1d6. Can be sold at market for 1 dust.
Super Rare Fish!: This super hard to catch fist can be sold for 3 dust at market. Roll 1d6.
Eat to gain +1D and improve effect on all command and charm rolls for a scene.
Eat to gain +1D and increased effect on Endure and Smash actions for a scene.
Ask the fish for advice. If you follow it, gain +1D and improved effect on your next narrative action.
Can be drunk to gain a vigor surge.
Eat as free action to end all statuses and foeâ€™s marks.
Can be sold at market for 3 dust.
The fish is infused with reality warping Aether. You can use the fish to perform one action roll as superpowered, expending it.

This magnificent specimen sells for 5 dust at market. Alternately, its scales are so tough it can be used as a shield. At the start of combat, expend the fish to give a character 10 vigor, which could put them over their maximum.

description.content: Hidden objects, paths, tracks, or traps
Invisible or metaphysical objects or forces, such as the flow of magic.
One person or monster close by
All people or monsters close by
Until the end of the scene
Until the end of the expedition
Within two or three hundred paces.
One person or a small object.
A whole group of people or a large object.
A whole town, or a massive object such as a train, huge machine, etc.
Characters can spend 1 effort to heal 1 strain.
Small, like a vase or stool.
Large, like a piece of furniture or a door.
Massive, like a horse cart or boulder.
